about_the_game:
Story

Marsel is an alien who has land crashed on Earth and needs to repair his spaceship to return to his planet. However, the parts he needs for the repair are found only at Circuses on Earth! Not only that, but some spare parts are only available in the past or the future!

Marsel will need to search for these parts while avoiding being discovered and caught by the Earthlings inhabiting the Circus, but all of them are highly trained performers! Marsel will face many challenging obstacles and enemies in this exciting platform game.

Will you help Marsel complete his mission and return safely home?

References

Marsel, the Alien Clown is a tribute to the platform games genre that millions of children around the globe enjoyed in the 80s and 90s. Today, those children have become adults and, like us here at 1up, haven't stopped dreaming about the references from our childhood. We love to remember the colorful world of Mario Bros, the addictive gameplay of Rayman, and the thrilling adventure of Pitfall.

Gameplay

Marsel, the Alien Clown is a 2D platform video game that combines classic gameplay mechanics with state-of-the-art design technology. The goal is to help Marsel complete a series of levels by jumping, running, and avoiding obstacles while collecting objects and power-ups.

Marsel has one essential ability in the game: he can time travel to the past and the future. This game mechanic will generate different and lively gameplay.

name: Marsel - The Alien Clown

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 (64-Bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 6100
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 or higher | AMD R7 360 or higher
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Specifications are subject to change.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Explore the magical world of Circus with Marsel in this wonderful 2D platform game inspired by classic platformer games of the 90's. When Marsel's spaceship crashes on Earth, he discovers that the parts needed for repairs can only be found on Circuses of yesterday, today, and tomorrow!
